description: Creates a VPC with the specified CIDR blocks. For more information, see IP addressing for your VPCs and subnets in the Amazon VPC User Guide. You can optionally request an IPv6 CIDR block for the VPC. You can request an Amazon-provided IPv6 CIDR block from Amazon's pool of IPv6 addresses or an IPv6 CIDR block from an IPv6 address pool that you provisioned through bring your own IP addresses ( BYOIP). By default, each instance that you launch in the VPC has the default DHCP options, which include only a default DNS server that we provide (AmazonProvidedDNS). For more information, see DHCP option sets in the Amazon VPC User Guide. You can specify the instance tenancy value for the VPC when you create it. You can't change this value for the VPC after you create it. For more information, see Dedicated Instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

parameters.name: Ipv6CidrBlock
parameters.description: The IPv6 CIDR block from the IPv6 address pool. You must also specify Ipv6Pool in the request. To let Amazon choose the IPv6 CIDR block for you, omit this parameter.

parameters.name: Ipv6CidrBlockNetworkBorderGroup
parameters.description: The name of the location from which we advertise the IPV6 CIDR block. Use this parameter to limit the address to this location. You must set AmazonProvidedIpv6CidrBlock to true to use this parameter.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to assign to the VPC. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: InstanceTenancy
parameters.description: The tenancy options for instances launched into the VPC. For default, instances are launched with shared tenancy by default. You can launch instances with any tenancy into a shared tenancy VPC. For dedicated, instances are launched as dedicated tenancy instances by default. You can only launch instances with a tenancy of dedicated or host into a dedicated tenancy VPC. Important: The host value cannot be used with this parameter. Use the default or dedicated values only. Default: default.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the VPC.

nested_items.name: InstanceTenancy
nested_items.description: The allowed tenancy of instances launched into the VPC.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlockAssociationSet
nested_items.description: Information about the IPv6 CIDR blocks associated with the VPC.

nested_items.name: AssociationId
nested_items.description: The association ID for the IPv6 CIDR block.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv6 CIDR block.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlockState
nested_items.description: Information about the state of the CIDR block.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the CIDR block.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A message about the status of the CIDR block, if applicable.

nested_items.name: NetworkBorderGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the unique set of Availability Zones, Local Zones, or Wavelength Zones from which Amazon Web Services advertises IP addresses, for example, us-east-1-wl1-bos-wlz-1.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Pool
nested_items.description: The ID of the IPv6 address pool from which the IPv6 CIDR block is allocated.

nested_items.name: Ipv6AddressAttribute
nested_items.description: Public IPv6 addresses are those advertised on the internet from Amazon Web Services. Private IP addresses are not and cannot be advertised on the internet from Amazon Web Services.

nested_items.name: IpSource
nested_items.description: The source that allocated the IP address space. byoip or amazon indicates public IP address space allocated by Amazon or space that you have allocated with Bring your own IP (BYOIP). none indicates private space.

nested_items.name: CidrBlockAssociationSet
nested_items.description: Information about the IPv4 CIDR blocks associated with the VPC.

nested_items.name: AssociationId
nested_items.description: The association ID for the IPv4 CIDR block.

nested_items.name: CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv4 CIDR block.

nested_items.name: CidrBlockState
nested_items.description: Information about the state of the CIDR block.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the CIDR block.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A message about the status of the CIDR block, if applicable.

nested_items.name: IsDefault
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the VPC is the default VPC.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: (dict) ---

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags assigned to the VPC.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: BlockPublicAccessStates
nested_items.description: The state of VPC Block Public Access (BPA).

nested_items.name: InternetGatewayBlockMode
nested_items.description: The mode of VPC BPA.
off: VPC BPA is not enabled and traffic is allowed to and from internet gateways and egress-only internet gateways in this Region.

nested_items.type: except for excluded VPCs and subnets
nested_items.description: block-bidirectional: Block all traffic to and from internet gateways and egress-only internet gateways in this Region (except for excluded VPCs and subnets).

nested_items.type: except for VPCs or subnets which are excluded
nested_items.description: block-ingress: Block all internet traffic to the VPCs in this Region (except for VPCs or subnets which are excluded). Only traffic to and from NAT gateways and egress-only internet gateways is allowed because these gateways only allow outbound connections to be established.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the VPC.

nested_items.name: CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The primary IPv4 CIDR block for the VPC.

nested_items.name: DhcpOptionsId
nested_items.description: The ID of the set of DHCP options you've associated with the VPC.
